title: Symphony No. 5 in C Minor, Op. 67: I. Allegro con brio
lyrics: Opens with the iconic four-note 'short-short-short-long' fate motif, which dominates the entire dramatic and intense movement, developing through powerful orchestral tutti and moments of quiet tension.

title: Eine kleine Nachtmusik, K. 525: I. Allegro
lyrics: A famously cheerful and energetic serenade for strings. [1] The first movement is characterized by a bright, ascending Mannheim rocket theme, graceful melodies, and a clear, balanced structure typical of the Classical era. [2]

title: Cello Suite No. 1 in G Major, BWV 1007: I. Prélude
lyrics: An iconic solo cello piece featuring a sequence of arpeggiated chords that explore the harmony and resonance of the instrument. It creates a sense of contemplative and flowing momentum.

chord_progression.main_sequence: G - D - Em - C - Am - D7

title: Suite bergamasque, L. 75: III. Clair de lune
lyrics: A dreamy and atmospheric piano solo, one of the most famous examples of musical impressionism. [25, 10] Its title, meaning 'moonlight,' is reflected in the delicate, ethereal texture and flowing, lyrical melody. [25, 13]

title: The Four Seasons, Violin Concerto in E Major, Op. 8 No. 1, RV 269, 'Spring': I. Allegro
lyrics: A vibrant and joyful concerto depicting the arrival of Spring. [32] The music programmatically illustrates birdsong with trills from the solo violin, murmuring streams, and a sudden thunderstorm. [5, 30, 6, 19]

title: Canon in D Major, P. 37
lyrics: Built on a repeating two-measure ground bass, this piece features three violins in a canon, weaving intricate and harmonious melodic lines over a steady, elegant foundation.

chord_progression.ground_bass: D - A - Bm - F#m - G - D - G - A

title: The Rite of Spring, Part 1: Adoration of the Earth
lyrics: A revolutionary ballet score depicting pagan rituals. [34, 39] Characterized by jarring, dissonant harmonies, complex, shifting rhythms, and primal, percussive energy that famously caused a riot at its 1913 premiere. [14, 47]

title: Gymnopédie No. 1
lyrics: A slow, atmospheric, and minimalist piano piece with a simple, melancholic melody over a deliberate, swaying chordal accompaniment. The title refers to ancient Greek ceremonial dances. [15, 21, 50, 43, 40]

title: Carmina Burana: O Fortuna
lyrics: A powerful and dramatic cantata opening with a full chorus and orchestra. The music depicts the turning of the Wheel of Fortune, building from an ominous whisper to a thunderous, epic climax.

title: In the Hall of the Mountain King
lyrics: From the 'Peer Gynt' suite, this piece depicts the main character's escape from the troll king's castle. [44, 36] It builds from a stealthy, pizzicato beginning to a frantic, chaotic, and accelerating orchestral frenzy. [3, 45, 35]

title: Rhapsody in Blue
lyrics: A seminal work blending classical music with jazz idioms. [11] Opens with a famous clarinet glissando, leading into a series of virtuosic piano passages, bluesy melodies, and lush, symphonic textures. [17, 31, 37, 49]

title: Boléro
lyrics: A one-movement orchestral piece based on a single, insistent Spanish-style melody and rhythm. [8, 12, 16] It builds in a relentless, gradual crescendo over 15 minutes as different instruments and sections take up the theme. [24, 33]

title: Messiah, HWV 56: Hallelujah Chorus
lyrics: A triumphant and iconic chorus from the oratorio 'Messiah.' Features a powerful interplay between choir and orchestra, with resounding declarations of 'Hallelujah!' building to a majestic and glorious conclusion.

title: Nocturne in E-Flat Major, Op. 9 No. 2
lyrics: A lyrical and expressive solo piano piece. Characterized by a beautiful, flowing melody in the right hand over a gentle, waltz-like accompaniment in the left hand, with elaborate ornamentation.

title: Adagio for Strings, Op. 11
lyrics: A deeply emotional and melancholic piece for string orchestra. It unfolds through a single, seamless melody that slowly builds in intensity and texture to a powerful, cathartic climax before resolving in quiet despair.

title: The Planets, Op. 32: I. Mars, the Bringer of War
lyrics: A powerful and menacing orchestral movement. [4, 41] Defined by a relentless, percussive 5/4 rhythm and dissonant, brass-heavy orchestration that creates a sense of impending conflict and brutal, mechanical force. [28, 42, 38]

title: Die Walküre, WWV 86B: Ride of the Valkyries
lyrics: An exhilarating and famous orchestral piece from the opera 'Die Walküre.' It features a powerful, galloping rhythm and a heroic, brassy leitmotif that depicts the mythical Valkyries flying through the sky.

title: Also sprach Zarathustra, Op. 30: I. Einleitung, oder Sonnenaufgang
lyrics: A monumental and iconic tone poem opening, famously used in '2001: A Space Odyssey.' It begins with a sustained low C, building with powerful brass and timpani to a majestic, awe-inspiring sunrise fanfare.

title: Symphony No. 9 in E Minor, 'From the New World', Op. 95, B. 178: II. Largo
lyrics: A beautiful and nostalgic slow movement. It is famous for its soulful and lyrical English horn solo, which evokes the feeling of a spiritual or folk song, creating a sense of deep longing and peace.

title: A Night on Bald Mountain
lyrics: A wild and programmatic tone poem depicting a witches' Sabbath. The music is dark, chaotic, and grotesque, with frantic strings, powerful brass, and a sense of demonic, frenzied dancing.

title: Finlandia, Op. 26
lyrics: A patriotic tone poem evoking the Finnish national struggle. It moves from turbulent, agitated passages to a serene, hymn-like melody (the 'Finlandia Hymn') before concluding with a triumphant, majestic finale.

title: Fanfare for the Common Man
lyrics: A noble and powerful fanfare for brass and percussion. [18] Written during WWII, it features majestic, resonant chords and a heroic, declarative melody that creates a sense of dignity and solemn celebration. [27, 48, 29, 46]

title: Symphony No. 3 in F Major, Op. 90: III. Poco allegretto
lyrics: A lyrical and melancholic intermezzo. Instead of a lively scherzo, this movement is a beautiful, waltz-like piece with a soaring cello melody and a sense of gentle, romantic yearning and introspection.

title: Ave Maria, D. 839
lyrics: A beautiful and serene setting of a prayer to the Virgin Mary. The piece features a lyrical, flowing vocal melody over a gentle, arpeggiated piano accompaniment, creating a sense of peace and devotion.

title: Piano Concerto No. 1 in B-Flat Minor, Op. 23: I. Allegro non troppo e molto maestoso
lyrics: A grand and iconic piano concerto. The first movement opens with one of the most famous and powerful themes in all of classical music, featuring heroic piano chords against a lush, sweeping orchestral backdrop.
